typesdata.title: Merit-Based Scholarship
typesdata.description: Merit-based scholarships are awarded to students who demonstrate exceptional academic performance. These scholarships are typically offered by universities or private organizations and can cover a significant portion of tuition fees. They aim to recognize and reward high-achieving students, helping to reduce the financial burden of studying abroad in Japan. Students with excellent grades or outstanding talents may qualify for these scholarships.

typesdata.title: Need-Based Scholarship
typesdata.description: Need-based scholarships are designed to assist students who require financial support to pursue their education in Japan. These scholarships are awarded based on the student's financial need and are typically intended to cover tuition fees, living expenses, and other study-related costs. Students who come from economically disadvantaged backgrounds or who are facing financial challenges may be eligible for these scholarships.

typesdata.title: Language Proficiency Scholarships
typesdata.description: Language proficiency scholarships are awarded to students who wish to study the Japanese language but may not have advanced proficiency. These scholarships typically support students who enroll in Japanese language programs to improve their language skills. They may cover tuition fees for language courses or provide additional funding to help students immerse themselves in the language and culture. Students who have passed certain Japanese language proficiency exams, like JLPT N5 or N4, may also qualify for these scholarships.
